--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "mllejade" <leongbabe=
@...> wrote:
>
> Hello Ursula and Draiga,
> 
> From my experience with all =
kinds of cameras, I say it's best to experiment. On one of my experiments, =
I went to a purported haunted alley and took 4 different shots using 4 diff=
erent cameras from the same angle, taking the photos one after the other wi=
thin a minute's span. The 4 cameras I used were: 1. Moditronics' so-called =
"Full Spectrum" (which I've dubbed "Duo-Spectrum" because it only sees into=
 the near UV and IR spectrums, excluding the visible spectrum altogether) a=
nd 2. Moditronics "Deep IR" which only sees into the IR spectrum, excluding=
 the visible and UV spectrums, 3. a "Full Spectrum" camera, which sees all =
3 spectrums (i.e., UV, visible and IR) and 4. a regular digital point n' sh=
oot consumer camera. The results were interesting. In the pictures I shot w=
ith Moditronics' Full ("Duo") Spectrum camera and "Deep IR" camera, I got a=
 face floating in a fire escape from the side of a building adjoining the a=
lley; that face did not show up on
 neither the full spectrum camera nor on=
 the point n' shoot camera. Interesting indeed. I intend to carry on with m=
ore experiments of this type, i.e., shooting the same scene using multiple =
cameras with different capabilities. BTW, as you may already know, the Modi=
tronics camera takes stills as well as video, and it records onto SD cards.=
 
> 
> Ursula, thanks for your review on the SpecterCam 3, which I'll defin=
itely look into purchasing. In the past I've purchase accessories from the =
SpecterCam site and the site's owner is definitely very knowledgeable. My p=
hilosophy is that we know so little about this research is that I may as we=
ll try it all (if I could afford it, that is).
> 
> Draiga - if you decide =
to make videos with one of the SpecterCam cameras, and you want sound, be s=
ure you also have a digital voice recorder running at the same time as DVR =
cameras record only images, and not sound. Also, about Moditronics' full sp=
ectrum and deep IR cameras, you'll need an external light source if you fil=
m at night since those cameras do not see into the visible spectrum and if =
it's a pitch black or very dark environment, they won't see anyhing without=
 a light source. However, they're perfect for daytime ghost hunting, which =
I do as well as night-time investigations (I don't believe that ghosts only=
 come out and show themselves at night).
> 
> Hope that helps. When I find =
time, I will post the photos from my alley experiment.
> 
> Sharon from SF
